TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BackupDataInput extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary:
Provides the structured interface through which a reads information from the backup data set, via its
method.

remarks.para:
Provides the structured interface through which a reads information from the backup data set, via its
method. The data is presented as a set of "entities," each representing one named record as previously stored by the agent's implementation. An entity is composed of a descriptive header plus a byte array that holds the raw data saved in the remote backup.

The agent must consume every entity in the data stream, otherwise the restored state of the application will be incomplete.
Example

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int ReadEntityData (byte[] data, int offset, int size);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 ReadEntityData(unsigned int8[] data, int32 offset, int32 size) cil managed

Docs.param: An allocated byte array of at least 'size' bytes
Offset within the 'data' array at which the data will be placed when read from the stream
The number of bytes to read in this pass
Docs.summary: Read a record's raw data from the restore stream.

remarks.para: Read a record's raw data from the restore stream. The record's header must first have been processed by the method. Multiple calls to this method may be made in order to process the data in chunks; not all of it must be read in a single call. Once all of the raw data for the current entity has been read, further calls to this method will simply return zero.

Docs.exception: if an error occurred when trying to read the restore data stream

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<int> ReadEntityDataAsync (byte[] data, int offset, int size);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<int32> ReadEntityDataAsync(unsigned int8[] data, int32 offset, int32 size) cil managed
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ReadNextHeader() cil managed

Docs.summary: Extract the next entity header from the restore stream.

remarks.para: Extract the next entity header from the restore stream. After this method return success, the and methods can be used to inspect the entity that is now available for processing.

Docs.exception: if an error occurred while reading the restore stream

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> ReadNextHeaderAsync() cil managed
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SkipEntityData() cil managed

Docs.summary: Consume the current entity's data without extracting it into a buffer for further processing.

remarks.para: Consume the current entity's data without extracting it into a buffer for further processing. This allows a to efficiently discard obsolete or otherwise uninteresting records during the restore operation.

Docs.exception: if an error occurred when trying to read the restore data stream

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
